Article.Title: NEW GAME
Article.Html: The first graphical Beaufort game is here - "The Ledge" - a ten-minute thriller available for download on itch.io, gamejolt, or rpgmaker.net. Right now it's only available for Mac and PC, but stay tuned for Android and iOS support!

Article.Title: NEW YEAR
Article.Html: Beaufort have spent the last several months developing new projects and scripts. We're currently in Tokyo setting up the next thing so stay tuned!

Article.Title: STORIES
Article.Html: The short story 'Durian Durian' from the collection 'Emergency? Yeah!' is now online and interactive! Made as an experiment with Twine, the pathways are pretty basic, but the first-person perspective suits the format: http://duriandurian.neocities.org/

Article.Title: CINEMA
Article.Html:
ARIADNE is now online!

---------------->

The script for Ariadne was originally simply a sequence in a feature script, but when it was cut during development, it seemed self-contained enough to shoot on its own. We shot it over a day in January. Thanks again to all cast and crew.

Article.Title: CINEMA
Article.Html:
ARIADNE, our new short film, will premiere online Monday morning 20th July, Sydney-time.

In other news, James McFay has been writing a film with Patrick Hughes (Red Hill, Expendables 3).

There will be an interactive story from Emergency? Yeah! coming soon.

Article.Title: MUSIC
Article.Html: We have a new album available - it's called 'Cinehearts' and is a collection of instrumentals made over the last five years for films, including Tiger, Burning Hearts and Ariadne. The album is free to stream on Soundcloud and available to buy on Bandcamp.

Article.Subtitle: INTERVIEWS
Article.Html:
We have a new Soundcloud playlist called 'Interviews' and so far it features three tracks:

1) A 3-hour interview with Oscar-winning Quebecoise director Denys Arcand, conducted by James McFay.
2) An interview about Burning Hearts with James McFay by Raymond Kouguell for Voice Of America, 'Focus on Asia'.
3) The Indonesian translation of the Voice Of America interview, for the Indonesian service.
A teaser trailer for our new short Ariadne is now online.

FINAL NEWS FOR 2013:

1. Beaufort has completed a new short 'Ariadne' which is currently in post.
2. 'Burning Hearts' won the International Grand Prix at the Curtocircuito Film Festival in Spain.

3. The Emergency? Yeah! code was cracked by Andrew Johnston of NSW. He won the $100 Amazon Voucher.

4. Beaufort will cease all music production in 2014.

'Emergency? Yeah!' is in it's 3rd Edition, and to celebrate, Beaufort is giving away a $100 Amazon voucher! The first person to successfully crack the code and decipher the secret section at the back of the book will win a $100 Amazon Voucher.

HOW TO ENTER: Buy the book here and follow the instructions in the hidden code!

'Emergency? Yeah!' won best in Fiction at the Woollahra Local Writer's Word Festivalin Sydney, Australia.

The competition is for self-published books.
All the major works by Beaufort are now, very definitely, available to download in one torrent file. Download it here or learn more below in the Download section.

We have a new piece of music online.

It’s called ‘Money On You’.
Our short film ‘Burning Hearts’ is now online.

Watch it above or in the cinema section to the right.

Here is a review from the recent Glasgow Film Festival:

“If I’m to be sincere, from all the different fiction works included in the international sections, there was only one which truly amazed me. I won’t discuss some of the flaws of the work, as that leads nowhere.

Burning hearts is one of those works made with naturalness and courage, a kamikaze short film, with no prejudice in making a U turn in its plot just to take us into a vortex of blood and kung fu. The Japanese short film by James Mcfay is just like that; you take it or leave it.

I’ll take it.”

-Jorge Rivero

Article.Subtitle: Petit Homme
Article.Html: While the book of short stories is at the printers being proofed, I thought it was time to upload an old short film - the first from Beaufort. For some reason it has never been shown to the public in any form until now. Shot in 2006, by a bunch of Power Rangers actors and crew on their weekend off.
CREDITS here.

Article.Subtitle: Cambridge Film Festival + Other Stuff
Article.Html: Burning Hearts will make it’s UK premiere this month at the Cambridge Film Festival:

For those asking, all screenings of Burning Hearts prior to June 2012 were of a work-in-progress (unfinished grade, soundtrack and FX).

Burning Hearts, in its finished state, made its world premiere in June at the Sydney Film Festival. Cambridge will be its third proper screening after the Cannes short film corner.

In other news, Beaufort’s book of short stories is almost finished (only six years in the making!) and some new music will be on our Soundcloud player before the year is out.
